name: Gallon House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked in for one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary and it was a lovely visit. The first tip is to try and come by train as the entrance to the hotel is only 30 seconds from the platform. The lounge, sun room and terrace are relaxing, well designed and just what was needed to chill out. Our room was the Castle View on the top floor and gave superb views towards the castle one way and over the viaduct in the other direction. The room was cosy and there were numerous welcoming treats such as a bottle of Black Sheep Ale, filter coffee and fresh milk.
reviews.title: Gorgeous stay with brilliant views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in for the evening meal which was superb and there is a good wine list to choose from. Breakfast the following morning was also excellent and Rick was good enough to allow us to leave our bag in the hotel whilst we went to explore the town. We returned home by train again - there is a regular and apparently efficient service between Leeds and York.
reviews.title: Wonderful place and wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can certainly fully recommend Gallon House if you want a relaxing break where life just slows down.
reviews.title: Anniversary Treat

reviews.text: I arranged a night away for myself and my partner Clare to celebrate her birthday. When I booked the room I let Sue know that it was a special occasion and she was able to arrange for flowers and chilled champagne to be in our room on arrival.
reviews.title: Paradise of Knaresborough

reviews.text: We arrived on the saturday afternoon and after a brief walk arounf Knaresborough we checked into the hotel. Rick was very welcoming and gave us a tour of the hotel before showing us to our room (top floor overlooking the river and bridge). The room was lovely, and we had a fantastic night's sleep in the big bed.
reviews.title: Sensational

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A long overdue review here! We stayed at Gallon House in May of this year for our daughters first birthday (she won't remember it, but we certainly will!!) We stayed in the castle view room, which as many reviewers have pointed out has some great views, it is well furnished and homely as is every area of the house from the conservatory (with more great views) to the huge settees which you just sink into in the living room area. We chose to ate at the hotel for all 3 nights of our stay both because of the convenience with having a baby with us and the reviews of Ricks food. Just as all the other reviews tell you, we were not disappointed! We were a little wary of having to sit at a dining table with people who we didn't know as we had our daughter with us, but on the 2 nights where we were dining with other guests it was no problem at all and we had an evening of great food and conversation. The food on each night was varied, so so tasty and well presented, Rick was able to accomodate my daughters dietry requirements also (he also made her a little piped potato birthday cake with candle on her big day too!) I also came away with Rick's recipe for his mushroom tartlet which was so nice I had to know how to make it! The location is very good - within easy reach of both York and Harrogate, and there is a very good pub across the road from the train station!! Parking is a bit of a pain, but nothing which could detract from such a relaxing treat of a stay. We'll definately be back to Gallon House in the future and can recommend to all, that if you are looking for somewhere to stay in Knaresborough or the surrounding area, that Gallon House is a must (& make sure you book yourselves in for dinner too!)
reviews.title: A warm, welcoming stay, beautiful building & excellent food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had found Gallon house, as many others, via the internet. We were not disappointed and enjoyed the pace and atmosphere of the hotel enormously. The food was fabulous and certainly made the weekend a gastronomic delight. As it was our silver wedding anniversary we had chosen to eat elsewhere, apart from the evening we arrived, as we wanted to have a more intimate dining experience than Gallon was able to offer, this is not a criticism. We would recommmend that you make time during your stay to just sit and enjoy the view from Gallon over the Nidd it really is stunning and I for one could have easily spent an entire day watching the trains, boats and wildlife in the gardens and on the river below. A disappointment was not catching a flash of blue of the resident kingfisher but the variety of many other birds made up for this. There is lots to enjoy in Knaresborough and when the sun came out it was quite magical. There is an interesting set of trompe d'oeil paintings around the town and it is quite good fun trying to track them all down. Further afield there is breathtaking scenery in abundance and a trip to Harrogate on the train with tea at Betty's is a great way to spend a day. Rick and Sue make a trip to Yorkshire every bit worth the journey and as i said in their personal guest book the hotel should be availble on the NHS. Rick needs to find a way of bottling the experience and selling it as it would certainly warrant a Premier Cru label.
reviews.title: A perfect place to spend our anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Gallon House after the great reviews on TripAdvisor, and we weren't disappointed. A particular draw was the promise of Rick's cooking and it was excellent - easily the best meal out we've had in ages! The evening meal was just superb and we were lucky enough to be able to eat alone as we both thought sharing a dining table with the other guests could go either way. We were treated to smoked mackerel and smoked salmon pate with Balsamic croutons followed by herb-stuffed chicken breast with Provencal sauce, potato rosti, mange toutes and tarragon carrots (or Harrogate carrots, as I heard it). All perfectly cooked and presented. Pudding was brandy-snap basket with fresh strawberries and ice-cream. Delicious!
reviews.title: Come for the views, stay for the food!

reviews.text: Service was always polite, friendly, interested but unobtrusive.
reviews.title: Unique and special place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was equally fantastic. Hard to improve on a full cooked breakfast, but home-made Black Pudding was a first and it was excellent.
reviews.title: A little luxury in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this 1 night away for my partners birthday. I had found this hotel last year on browsing the internet with good reviews for staying and eating there. I booked it early so as to not be disappointed and so i had a chance to save up lol. It's not cheap and with the meal and 2 bottles of wine the bill was well over £200 for 1 night but i wanted somewhere special..somewhere we wouldn't forget in a hurry. Firstly...the hotel is lovely, warm, inviting and very bright and airy, knaresborough is a beautiful historic town and the Gallon House was my only choice. Rick allowed us to check in early as we were going walking all afternoon which was nice. We were offered coffee in the conservatory on arrival...nice touch. We were given instructons on were to park for free and having a room over the back we could also see our car from our room. Our room was if i'm honest a little disappointing. I had seen the photos and was indeed looking forward to the spectacular views at the back of the house. We were shown around and were taken on to the balcony downstairs first and i thought wow...top marks but i couldnt mark this hotel ecellent like i wanted to. Our room was at the top of the house and was smaller than i had hoped for and the bathroom was a tad cramped. If you drop the soap in the shower you cannot retreive it. The room i wanted was the one with the balcony and as i had booked early i thought i would have had 1st choice as i was led to beleive no one else was booked in yet that weekend. However not to put a dampener on this review i hadn't asked for the balcony room...i just assumed both rooms at the back both had balconys...i shouldn't assume. Unfortunaltely ours didn't but i thought hey never mind we wont be in much to appreciate it and anyway it's winter so it goes dark early. I would however love to stay again but only in the balcony room over summer. The only thing i would say is for the price we paid you shouldn't have a blown window!!! We could only see out of one window...this to be fair is not acceptable when you pay for that little something extra.
reviews.title: Night away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To end on a positive the complimentry refreshments in the room were very good...got my complimentry shower products on leaving as Sue had forgotten to put them in the bathroom, you got bath robes to use and a bottle of black sheep ale to taste. the meal was fantastic and Rick was a very nice guy who did his best to accomodate. We never met Sue so cannot comment on it being a family run business. Maybe i'm getting picky in my old age or watching too much 4 in a bed but i just thought i would be marking this hotel excellent and unfortunaltely i'm not :(
reviews.title: Perfect end to our holiday

reviews.text: btw for all those reading past reviews...yes it is very close to the railway station but the trains do NOT run late. I am a very light sleeper but they didn't wake me.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in July 2009, and it was perfect. Before arriving we were asked if we wanted to stay for the dinner in the evening however as my husband is allergic to nuts we declined the meal because the menu showed nuts in a few items. I wish we had just told them earlier as they said they would have changed the menu for us.
reviews.title: An excellent week-end break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was amazing, I tried the homemade black pudding which I normally hate but it was delicious and I haven't found a black pudding since which matches up to it.
reviews.title: The best place I've ever stayed!!

reviews.text: Think about all your favourite things about the best B&Bs at which you have ever stayed in the UK and abroad - Gallon House then puts them all together in one beautifully appointed space. Rick and Sue have covered every detail to ensure a stay with them is memorable. From their wonderful welcome, to gin & tonics waiting in the conservatory overlooking the Nidd gorge, to delicious breakfasts to suit all tastes, and lovely rooms mixed with antiques and carefully chosen fabrics to give a french feel to their home, everything is chosen perfectly to make you feel comfortable at Gallon House. The en suite showers are neatly designed and compact in each of the three bedrooms, but the thick towels and Clarins products make up for any lack of space in abundance. Enjoy it all and the people you meet around the dining room table.
reviews.title: Everything is perfect at Gallon House

reviews.text: We stopped in the top room which affords excellent views of the spectacular valley, castle and viaduct. On arrival we were welcomed with tea, coffee and home made shortbread which was very much appreciated and a very nice touch indeed. The room we had was lovely and very well decorated, as is the rest of the house. The breakfasts were excellent (the homemade tomato chutney is delicious) and we opted to have one evening meal at Gallon House too. This was fantastic, the food wine and service were all excellent. We had the dining room to ourselves and it felt like eating in an intimate and exclusive restaurant.
reviews.title: Delightful stay at Gallon House
Top notch
reviews.text: Given the nature of the town itself parking is a minor issue but we would happily trade on site parking for the other benefits of stopping at this B&B. In summary, an excellent and very relaxing stay in a lovely location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perched above the Nidd gorge the Gallon House is not simply somewhere to stay, it's a destination in its own right.
reviews.title: Luxurious

reviews.text: Firstly it's a top notch B&B; welcoming, warm and comfy.
reviews.title: Gallon House, Amazing hospitality, spectacular place

description: Overlooking Knaresborough's beautiful Nidd Gorge, Gallon House offers award winning accommodation and delicious locally sourced food prepared by well known Yorkshire chef, Rick Hodgson
